title: Ulysse Nardin Releases ‘One More Wave’ Dive Watch
text:
Text size

Swiss watchmaker Ulysse Nardin has unveiled a limited edition of 100 “Diver Deep Dive” watches in partnership with One More Wave, a San Diego, Calif.-based nonprofit organization that helps wounded and disabled veterans with surf therapy.

The timepiece features a yellow-and-black dial with a black DLC (diamond-like carbon) titanium case. The back of the case is engraved with the “One More Wave” logo to signify the partnership.

The partnership came to fruition after François-Xavier Hotier, president of Ulysse Nardin Americas was introduced to Kyle Buckett, managing director of One More Wave, while visiting the U.S Navy SEALs Training Camp in Coronado, Calif.

“I had an unforgettable first-hand experience watching the veterans in the One More Wave program in action,” Hotier said in a statement. “Their dedication, courage, and camaraderie is inspiring, and we hope to bring more awareness to this important work.”

The caseback is engraved with "One More Wave" logo. Courtesy of Ulysse Nardin

The watch has a water resistance up to 1,000 meters, far beyond the 100-meter resistance most watches feature, allowing it to stand up to the highly variable pressures experienced while surfing.

Ulysse Nardin, founded in 1846 and a subsidiary of the French luxury conglomerate Kering Group since 2014, has long-standing ties to the sea. The watchmaker became the official supplier to the U.S. Navy after winning a competition to create the most precise marine chronometer in 1905.

One More Wave was founded in 2015 by members of the U.S. Navy SEALs community. The organization provides custom surfboards for wounded or disabled veterans.
description: The 100 limited editions retail for $13,500 apiece
